abstract: Yes, the Internet can be an echo chamber of agreeable opinions, but that ends when you use a search engine.
snippet: Yes, the Internet can be an echo chamber of agreeable opinions, but that ends when you use a search engine.
lead_paragraph: SCOLDS have long had a favorite complaint about the Internet: it’s one big echo chamber. By providing so much information, the Internet paradoxically has made it much easier to read only what you agree with  to inhabit a world where your own thoughts are repeated back to you.

headline.main: The Trouble With Tailoring a Web Search
headline.print_headline: The Trouble With Tailoring a Web Search

abstract: A move to encourage computer education reflects the concern that people will be divided between those who understand technology and those who are ruled by it.
snippet: A move to encourage computer education reflects the concern that people will be divided between those who understand technology and those who are ruled by it.
lead_paragraph: As I noted in an article Monday, the National Science Foundation wants to reform high school computer science education in America, expanding its reach and updating the curriculum to better prepare students for a 21st-century economy. Professional organizations and major technology companies, including Google, Microsoft and Intel support the broad agenda, though companies are not getting into curriculum details.

headline.main: Computer Science Education: It’s Not Shop Class

abstract: Yelp tie-up with Google off for the time being, but remains alluring as a route to the grail of local digital ad sales.
snippet: Yelp tie-up with Google off for the time being, but remains alluring as a route to the grail of local digital ad sales.
lead_paragraph: Word came last week that Google was looking to buy Yelp, the ubiquitous consumer-ratings service that can serve as guide when you need a certain kind of food (say falafel) in a certain town (let’s say Portland.) Yelp’s ratings are hardly foolproof, but having some knowledge of what other consumers thought of a place is far better than just taking your chances.

headline.main: Google’s Play for Yelp Seizes at Last Minute

abstract: Twitter is said to be in-the-black for the first time since its founding in 2006. Bloomberg News said that Twitter made $25 million in profit in 2009 from Internet search deals with Google and Microsoft. That may be a good start, but does it mean that its $1 billion valuation is right?
snippet: Twitter is said to be in-the-black for the first time since its founding in 2006. Bloomberg News said that Twitter made $25 million in profit in 2009 from Internet search deals with Google and Microsoft. That may be a good start, but does it mean ...
lead_paragraph: Twitter is said to be in-the-black for the first time since its founding in 2006. Bloomberg News, citing unidentified people, said that Twitter made $25 million in profit in 2009 from Internet search deals with Google and Microsoft. That may be a good start, but does it mean that its $1 billion valuation is right?

headline.main: Twitter Is Profitable! But Is It Worth $1 Billion?

abstract: Google was looking to buy Yelp and the deal was all but done when the target got cold feet, and the purchase seems to be off. In any case, whoever buys Yelp will inherit unresolved issues over what people should be allowed to say about each other online.
snippet: Google was looking to buy Yelp and the deal was all but done when the target got cold feet, and the purchase seems to be off. In any case, whoever buys Yelp will inherit unresolved issues over what people should be allowed to say about each other ...

headline.main: Google’s Play for Yelp Just Screeched…to a Halt

abstract: More than a million businesses use Google’s search advertising system to attract customers, a strategy combining gamesmanship with frequent data analysis.
snippet: More than a million businesses use Google’s search advertising system to attract customers, a strategy combining gamesmanship with frequent data analysis.
lead_paragraph: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif.  Cyber Monday had gone swimmingly for Tiny Prints.

headline.main: The Science of Managing Search Ads
headline.print_headline: Behind a Search Ad, a Struggle With Strategy

abstract: Yelp’s board determined that Google’s offer price was too low for the start-up, which publishes listings and reviews of local businesses.
snippet: Yelp’s board determined that Google’s offer price was too low for the start-up, which publishes listings and reviews of local businesses.
lead_paragraph: Yelp backed out of acquisition talks with Google over the weekend, according to two people briefed on the discussions.

headline.main: Yelp Turns Down Google, for Now
